analyzed: phussam jina varam disvā  phala hatthaḥ phalam ada
translated: but when I saw the Victorious One, the best of victors,🔽I gave him a fruit with my hand.
Because of the fruit I gave him
when I was reborn in a new existence,
a fruit was born for me.

original: Dvenavute ito kappe,🔽yaṁ phalaṁ adadiṁ ahaṁ;
analyzed: dvenavute itas kappe  yam phalam adadim aha
translated: For twenty-two eons,🔽the fruit I gave
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving a fruit.
I have done what the Awakened One has taught.”🔽Thus the elder Phaladāyaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā phaladāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Phaladāyakattherassāpadānaṁ sattamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā phaladāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽phaladāyaka therassa apadānam sattama
translated: The Elder Phaladāyaka’s Birth Story, the seventh.
